ATagQIyT3L979SNBe5M83g.text: First I tried to get a table but there wasn't one available so I got take away.  I had the penang curry and pad see eew.  Both were solidly good.

MwCC7sb8FS1nabs7_Ra-0w.text: I came here for lunch with a group of six; the waitress seated us on the ground floor (though I believe there is seating available on the above level as well). Very small and cosy space, but also rather chic-looking, and with decent prices for South Kensington eats. I ordered a starter - tod mun khao pod (corn cakes) - which was all right; the corn filling was a bit on the sticky/chewy side, but the chili sauce was a lovely touch. The service was not quite as attentive as it could have been (water refills were few and far between), and they actually couldn't make change for a £20 note, which was strange to me... It's not nearly the best Thai I've had, but it's worth a visit if you're already in the area.

RzRhpi0J6oynYdZTyYEimw.text: We had dinner here on Tuesday. The food is good and the service attentive and quick, but its not Patara.

rpw00mg3VuOwY0VN8gMIFA.text: very small restaurant but same good food as in the other, larger, Thai square restaurants. Also has a good location close to S Ken station

QTe-Ck8NOzZyioGb3ZTN2w.text: Mediocre Thai in a very bland atmosphere.  Crying Tiger was OK, but I feel like I wasted a nice meal in London choosing this spot.

bj3dgLk1VJKbgRR-xZzp8g.text: I have no complaints, the food was to a high standard and the staff was attentive.

FFCknJDHnWok4rAuPxrjFw.text: Stopped in here after a arduous battle with crowds near Harrods. We arrived for a late lunch and and had some of the best Thai I have ever had. Tom Kah Kai soup is killer and the pad thai is really well done. They have a full bar and the service was excellent. This place is a find and I would say, If you need a Thai fix, this place will do nicely.

SMJIaWekt6BtwE1gPeLxRA.text: Came here on a Saturday when Chelsea plays Manchester United so they had a set plate with 2 courses. Food quality is not bad.  The set plate was 14.95 pumps which is expensive for American standards. There are two reasons for 3 stars: only Singha beer offered and the main dish portion is very small.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Chicken with yellow curry.
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Set plate starter.
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Interior.

o0iShX0UEWj9RqTCEpfqyg.text: What a rip-off this place is. The food is mediocre at best and definitely overpriced for what you get. There are plenty of better choices all around this place; I wish I had picked one of them instead. Definitely avoid.

IiroXB9YLhZKu6ggxXfnew.text: Great price, quality and service for its location. We stopped by after leaving an event at the V&A after 930p on a Wednesday night. I had little hope for any decent restaurant being open at that hour, let alone a reasonably priced one in this high-end area.Thai Square was not only open, but friendly and fast. The price points were standard for London but not for this high-end area, so that was appreciated. I had filled up on free bites from the event before, so just got a beer (only one Thai beer available, boo) and an app for about £9. My husband got a chicken dish with coconut rice and was very pleased (about £9 for the main dish). I sampled his and found it to be tasty. The food came out hot and quickly. I wouldn't make a special trip to come back, but we are in this area often (by South Ken station, the V&A and the Natural History museums) and am happy to have it in my pocket for when I'm hungry and nearby.

15dEDmZsMfHFYV9455dm2A.text: I stopped here for lunch and their special (8.95 on weekdays). It was a good deal--spring roll, corn cake (both quite small), soup, veggies, rice, and green curry chicken. The flavors of everything were excellent. The green curry chicken was HOT even though they said medium spicy when I asked. They need to serve towels because I was sweating like crazy. The people at the table next to me were fanning themselves. The spiciness is addictive and I enjoyed every second, but boy, it was really spicy. Service was extremely attentive and efficient. I was thinking of getting ice cream but passed because I concluded that too was probably spicy. I cannot even imagine the heat level of what they call hot.  I am definitely returning.

Z0RqSVhnRZnqInrujcH5kg.text: The one thing you have to remember about going to this place is that it is Thai-Fusion. If you are looking for a straight Thai experience, then this isn't it. Otherwise, food is fine. Staff is okay. We made the mistake of showing up without a reservation, but the staff was still able to seat us as long as we didn't stay longer than 90 minutes.Wine list is nice. I had my first Thai red wine here.Probably won't go back, but you should try it at least once.

HP59abdsWVmbVpQI7TL0cQ.text: Food was pretty good, not exceptional but good. Service was fast. I had the green curry which was much more spicy than expected, but not bad. Don't bother ordering the coconut rice, it's basically just the same as steamed rice with a few shavings of coconut on top.

iqihcz190kkNevrGC-pq8A.text: A consistent four stars!I didn't like the Lamb, but all other dishes that I tried were fine (there were five us!). One of the better Thai restaurants that I've been to.And while you're sitting in the restaurant, after you've finished eating, pull out your mobile and run Monocle on your Yelp App. That got us heading to Cafe Creperie for deserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Upstairs

GvTZzjTec6JOXgPhAz-qUA.text: With a great location near the Natural History Museum, V&A, etc., Thai Square can get quite busy, particularly on weekends and during tourist season. I'm not sure about the layout and decor inside, as I chose to dine al fresco when I went.The menu is quite extensive, with a nice variety of appetizers, soups, salads and main dishes made with either chicken, beef, lamb, duck or shrimp. There are also 2-pages full of vegetarian options. I was quite happy with the vegetarian appetizer sampler (delicious little corn cakes, tempura veggies, spring roll) and the Thom Ke Had soup. I wasn't too happy with the service though, which was quite slow. In spite of its fairly touristy location, Thai Square does have very good food at decent prices, but it's not really anything spectacular.

fmAYqP2UwOSBeJRsdm52ow.text: Good inexpensive Thai food.  Quick friendly service. Perfect venue if visiting the Victoria and Albert and Natural History Museum.

W2wccu7oRaGJSVpuFMC5qw.text: Bullet Point review!:Decent Thai Red Curry.Very claustrophobic restaurant.A little pricey for dinner.Go for the lunch deal if at all

LpnKk2h9pPGWj3A1AMSo_A.text: Exquisite. Intimate little restaurant on two levels, only a few yards from South Kensington tube. Popped in here late at night and asked if they were still serving - they were. I had the Tom Kha Kai - chicken and coconut milk soup with exotic looking mushrooms - followed by green curry over steamed rice. I've written elsewhere that my yardstick for Thai restaurants is its green curry - and this was exquisite - the best I've had in London. Fast efficient service. Superb food, nicely displayed. All this and a drink for under 20 quid. I'm going to eat here more often.

BJjcmsBu2PQ1K-DdaEi3mQ.text: This is a great location very close to the V&A. The interior is cozy, and although the place was quite busy around 8:00p on a Friday night, we were seated within five minutes. My friend and I shared the combination appetizer to start with spring rolls, chicken satay, etc. (nothing extraordinary). He ordered the aromatic duck in tamarind sauce, and I ordered a prawn and scallop dish. The prawns and scallops were spicy, delicious and enormous - much more than I could eat. I ended up eating more than my share of the duck in tamarind sauce, as it was irresistibly tender and sweet. The mango sorbet and Jasmine tea were also both lovely.The service here is a bit slow, though not obscenely so. I would highly recommend Thai Square if you're looking for a leisurely, delicious and reasonably priced meal in South Kensington.

TkA6gMVvrCOVpDAsx_YsTQ.text: I'm not one for chain branded restaurants, but for Thai Square I always make an exception.Great service every time I go (and I have been to quite a few of them all over London), fantastic food and they also do a special student discount for students from the University of London with a 'StudentEAT' card.I would recommend the Pae Nang red curry and also the pad thai. The fishcakes are also great!It's not too much of a tourist place and it only serves Thai food. As a rule, I never dine in those places that do more than one type of food as I think the authenticity can be risky!

YH6ldAQEWvXUiqendDI55w.text: I don't understand how people have provided good rating for this restaurant , we had 3 different dishes all very mediocre , no spices and a very strange odour . If you like real Thai food don't go there!

MuAgkRENW-HcdkP06tUmRw.text: Don't let the fancy façade and the gold lettering on the outside of the restaurant fool you- Thai Square is a great place to go for a delicious laid back meal. In recent months, I had some Thai food that was good, but not great. So when I went to Thai Square I didn't have huge expectations.I came with a group of friends who love Thai food and knew what to order. I followed their lead and had prawn spring rolls, gang kiaw won with chicken and walked away happy! Our waitress was kind and also patient in explaining the items that I was not familiar with on the menu. I would definitely go back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom

LgNjQWSmZX2gyKRHLDbh5w.text: It's rare to find a place in London that can accommodate 10 people without a reservation at 9PM on a Thursday night and still serve up delicious hot reasonably priced food in 20 minutes or less.  Such is the beauty of Thai Square.  We piled in looking for a fast good meal en route to our next party and were immediately seated upstairs.  In no time the pleasant waitresses had served up cold beer and spicy seafood pad thai, green curry and an assortment of other great dishes.  All in it was about 10 quid per person and we left feeling great after about 45 minutes.

I7osuxp6DplYLEkNNSSzGA.text: I have never written a bad review of a restaurant before - but then I do not recall the last time I have been treated so badly.  I went to Thai Square with my wife and three kids.  They sat us upstairs  in a very small dining room next to a table of 12 people that had several bottles of wine on the table and were so loud that we had to scream to hear each other.  The room was very small and the noise was deafening.  After spending 10 minutes screaming "what" and "I cannot hear you" to each other, I asked the waitress if we could move downstairs or outside given the noise.  Instead of checking or even spending two seconds thinking of it, she flatly said "no."  Didn't even bother to check if there were tables available or turning over shortly.  When I explained that the noise was just too loud and asked again, she said "no" again w/o further thought.  We then cancelled our order.  On our way downstairs to leave the restaurant, we noticed that there were two 2-seat tables open in the first floor dining room that easily could have been put together to accommodate us.  When I asked if we could sit there - a different waitress said that these were reserved for another customer.  I am not sure why this customer was more important than us.So, we ended up walking down the street to Thai Taste and had an awesome meal -  great service and  quiet atmosphere.  Plus, I think it was less expensive.I am not sure if they are not "kid friendly" at Thai Square or just do not care about the customer - but we will not be back.

_BkcK1aE-uHVNSOtn42t2Q.text: Ate here with my Girlfriend and it was lovely. Food was immense and service impeccable. My only issue was that everyone was seated so close together. You couldn't get up to the toilet without banging in to the person behind you. Right near the tube so easy to get to. I would advise booking before hand as it's quite popular

lATh1YMU1qcX1sOeKOY8zw.text: Thai Taste down the road has better food and better service. We ordered an appetizer at Thai Square that never came. I know the server wrote it down. I think she realized the mistake but just decided not to mention it. All three of us ordered the same things here as we had at Thai Taste and all three of us preferred the food at Thai Taste. Thai Square has a cuter location near all the museums and whatnot, but it's worth the walk to check out Thai Taste instead.

8vsfx2OpKXFn2sO-lmoxHA.text: Had a wonderful lunch at this restaurant.  The food was great.  We had a lunch special that came with a variety of dishes to try.  The generous portions provided more food than we could eat.  The S. Kensington location is excellent as there are many tourist attractions nearby and it is a really lively area to walk around.

s32FrVqKvjc9Bzm2T4eExA.text: Upon entering, I was immediately greeted with friendly service and given a table. The service remained prompt throughout my meal. I chose this restaurant for the large amount of vegetarian items, and I had the cashew tofu, which was very delicious. It was the right amount of spice and flavor. I was asked if I wanted rice with it, which I agreed to, and I don't know in retrospect if that was an extra charge. Still, it was a reasonable price for a glass of white wine and a meal. I would return if in the area.

wqwTJtuJ71AMmjUtJyk7YA.text: Its location right down the street from Natural History Museum and Victoria and Albert Museum made this the reason we stopped in between visiting those museums. We ordered the reasonably priced set lunch (£9.95) which consisted of a corn cake, a spring roll, some type of lemongrass-ginger Mushroom soup, steamed veggies in a brown gravy, steamed white rice, and chicken green curry. Overall, the meal was good and filling, though it didn't blow me away. The only complaint I had about the meal was that the soup (the first thing I tried) was so incredibly tart and the mixture of the acidity with the chili's and abundant ginger burned my throat. The corn cake and spring roll where soggy on one side as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom

7ZWXITGGKAt-8pkntJ_Vrg.text: I was visiting London and had been exploring all the museums with my cousins. They got hungry and we decided to come here since the reviews said it was amazing. We got to the restaurant and were seated but the waitress didn't care to really serve us anytime soon although the restaurant wasn't busy at the time. One of my cousins wears a turban and although I don't want to make assumptions, but we often do see how much discrimination he faces at restaurants so we did feel a certain type of way when the waitress took forever to ask our order. When she finally did, we ordered Thai Tea, Tofu with Cashew Nuts, Coconut Rice and Chicken Pad Thai. When we got our order, instead of Chicken Pad Thai, we were given Chicken Satay. My younger cousin who has a low voice had ordered Chicken Pad Thai and we had all heard him at the table. When we told the server, he brought out the waitress and she denied that my cousin ordered Pad Thai. She kept repeating to him and us that he had ordered Chicken Satay as if my cousin was stupid. Anyways, he said it was fine and decided to eat the Chicken Satay which wasn't filling and his appetite was already ruined from the way the waitress treated him. We had been respectful the whole time but yes we didn't leave a tip because of how we were treated. I understand that servers and waiters go through a lot of obnoxious customers and sometimes your mood gets affected for the whole day but to take it out on another customer - a young teen, who simply wanted what he had originally ordered is pretty rude. I didn't want to leave such a long or rude review but I hope this review helps the restaurant more than anyone else in giving better service. We are all human and I'm sure the waitress didn't mean to be so rude but this did alter our perception of this restaurant.

mwsI8qwzlWe-cgXVHx-0oQ.text: I was craving Thai food. Poor service! I ordered pad thai and the noodle wasn't even cooked. Two star is one star too many...

tzBje9_pCH0oErfwQBV9LQ.text: We came in for dinner on a Monday night without a reservation and got lucky that they had a table. The food and service were both excellent!!!! I had Drunk Noodles and they were very authentic and fantastically hot! My hubs had the green curry and it was the same! Awesome! We would definitely come here again.

BTxwLi2BNCoxKHrEc9Q_NA.text: Rude staff and overhyped restaurant. Popped in for lunch and was turned away. Literally only wanted a soup to warm myself up but they were "full". Asked to sit outside and was told no. Asked to sit upstairs and was told upstairs closes at 3pm. It was 2pm and just wanted a damn soup. Again was told no.  Wasn't given the option to wait for a table.  So damn rude. Clearly they don't want the patronage. Will spend my money elsewhere.

lvdoDAHwfVUZZcx2dVW6AQ.text: Extremely rude staff.  After waiting 30 minutes for a table, decided to just leave after watching one of the waitress/hostess being rude to customers.

s06rpPxndkw8hv6Q7KlD-w.text: Came across this place after coming out of the museum and all the sushi places we wanted to go to was closed. The atmosphere was nice, a little crowded and small, but nice. The food was okay, my husband and I didn't like the Thai rice with the veges and seafood, the seafood was unpleasant, I love mussels and squid but didn't like it in the rice, it was cold and tasteless. The pad Thai was okay. The red curry was the best thing I had there...

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Thai rice
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Chicken satay
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Pad thai

hFgzku1m2jvZO21l7SdhIw.text: The view from upstairs is nice but the food is bad.  Even our kids, who never complain, did not like the food.  The veggies were not cooked, the rice was mushy and the food lacked any of the qualities expected of real Thai food.  Keep stepping...

SArHoo0g8i7OysOVCXIjFA.text: My husband and I came here for dinner on Monday night. We ordered the spicy lamb and the chicken jungle curry. Neither of the two meals were even remotely spicy or had any flavor other than salt. So very disappointed after choosing this restaurant over some of the other ones in the area. Do not waste your time or money at this location just very subpar. Would not recommend this restaurant nor return to it personally. Could've spent 50£ in a much better way.

H6UUI-oFGh2jCGVvxFFbPA.text: Stopped by for lunch and was seated quickly. Although there was a great lunch deal, I selected two appetizers for my meal as I only wanted a little snack: chicken satay, and the spicy fried squid. My food came out fast and the servers were great at checking back with me and refilling my water. I sat in the first dining area. It was bright and nicely decorated, if a bit crowded. The food was tasty, and nicely presented. It was actually more than enough to fill me up. Go!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. So good, I couldn't wait. chicken satay.
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Crispy calamari!

8Fild_twzwGpx57VfUnTEw.text: Okay not great. Not a lot of food. Obviously meant to trap tourists. Good location but i will not return there since I live in London.

lFGtlYFZJsWyWHrE_x_SCQ.text: Had a very pleasant late lunch here. Despite it being busy they managed to fit us in on the upper floor and we had a nice view of South Kensington.Service was attentive. Had piping hot duck spring rolls and chicken skewers with a tasty peanut sauce. Then a sliced beef salad with quick a spice kick but plenty of flavour depth as well. Would highly recommend for a Thai taste in this part of London.

vpRlGdawHU04HIo4tw160g.text: Exactly that - A Ok. It's average thai food at ok prices. Coming from NYC, where I can get average anywhere at £7, London average prices and taste are hard to swallow but one learns to adjust.I was very pleased with my Panang Curry. The pad thai was ok. Calamari starter good.  Seating was tight and service a bit brisk but I didn't expect anything more.This location can be mobbed with a wait - especially during peak dinner times with the proximity to the museums. Try to see if you can get a reservation through OpenTable or by calling or else go off-peak. A-Ok 3 stars.

sYzGdpiOyeiGtFfZWH0pNQ.text: We were wandering around Brompton Road when we found this place, can't say I would recommend it. Food is ok, we had Massaman chicken curry and it was not what I had expected, it didn't balance nicely with tamarind sauce and the rest of the spices. Staff are friendly and nice but other then that there is nothing special about this place

YZEY_RCVPvsxNLT8DqPgNQ.text: I had spicy lamb £9.85 and rice £2.25 but the lamb was not really spicy even though it's a 2-chili course. The taste is average, something I can cook at home easily. Service is good. I prefer busabah Eathai for Thai food, cheaper and more tasty.

G7UIOijoPUcKY_mtiyW0Ng.text: I went to this restaurant for early dinner with my friends after our visit at the Natural History Museum.  We were the first to arrive at 5:30pm so didn't have any problem finding a table in a small dining room on the ground floor.  Large windows made the room look specious.The food was great but I guess it lacked the wow-factor.  I liked the crispy corn cake appetizer the most out of everything I had that night.  It was really crispy and juicy outside and filled with mashed corn kernels inside :)  The pad thai wasn't served with a slice of lime and the dish tasted a little bland because of that.  Tom kha hed (coconut mushroom soup), on the other hand, was plenty sour and delicious.We also felt the portion was a bit small.  It's a decent place at a convenient location if you are in South Kensington.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Mango sorbet
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Tom kha hed soup
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Green curry, sticky rice and corn cake

WcP3BMbv7noblaM1HM7vxg.text: I wish I had wonderful things to say about this Thai restaurant but it was just ... Meh. Ok.Value for money - barely. Service with a smile - not so much. Authentic Taste - some so, some not so. Would I eat here again - not any time soon.We were greeted with a 10 minute wait. I saw this as a positive however it soon turned to 20. This is no reflection of what I thought of my meal. Service was average at best. A smile would go a long way. The food was fresh but over cooked. I ordered the beef green curry and my colleague ordered the prawn noodles. Both flavoursome but the meats were over cooked and rubbery. I didn't think it was great value for money. I would have given it more stars but no atmosphere, no great service and no great food to speak ok. A forgettable meal experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom. Sweet Chilli Squid

bN91y878ZOho-yvzNgiWkw.text: the pad thai is nice but the bean sprout on it is uncooked. I do not really like raw vegetable. pad thai is not too oily, it is more sour than the pad thai I've ever ate. and the no.43 on the menu (stir fried beef) is very very nice. a little expensive for me.

TCjd_bhwowc4AdHP6vKG4w.text: Thai Square is located next to the South Kensington Tube station and the V&A. The restaurant is small and intimate and has tables on three separate floors. I have eaten here by myself and with friends for both lunch and dinner on several occasions over the past three years. The service has always been fast and attentive. Prior to this visit, I felt the food was good at a reasonable price. On the last two visits something has changed...I just don't feel the 'Wow-Factor' anymore. Just okay-not good-definitely not great. I worked in Thailand for several years, I can take the heat of Thai peppers and spicy food.  The Som Tum (papaya salad), however, was so hot this evening that I couldn't eat the salad because my tongue was on fire. Even the presentation of my dishes was lackluster which is not characteristic of Thai cuisine. The restaurant claims to hold two "Best Restaurant of the Year" awards in 2012 and 2014. Like I said, something has changed.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Square - London, United Kingdom
